(In reply to comment #0)
> Has someone else the same problem as me?

Yes I do, although I am still using WinXP SP1. The Server has Problems on 
downloading binary files including images. HTML files are working without 
problems. The behaviour is very indeterministic. Sometimes it downloads a file 
perfectly, sometimes I get garbled data and most of the time Apache simply 
stops working. After that, shutting down the service won't work. A runaway 
apache process still remains running.

I have also expirienced this problems not only with GET-requests but also with 
mod_dav's PROPFIND-requests. A PROPFIND on a binary file does not work.

The same tests are working perfectly under Linux.

text:
I  also have this problem. I have tried 2.0.53, 2.0.54 and 2.0.55, with PHP 
5.0.5 as embedded module and MySQL. 

The webserver stops responding, completely sporadically, and only a restart of 
the apache2 service can resolve it. Sometimes I have to shut the service down, 
wait a few sec's, and then start it up again. I haven't found any way to 
recreate this bug, and even though I use debug-level logging, there is no 
mentioning of any problems preceeding the lockups.

I use a clean install Windows 2003 Server with NO patching what so ever.
I've downgraded to 1.3.33, and now it has run smoothly for a week, but a 
little slower :(

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
BTLoader and Andre; please first verify 2.0.55 (which fixes a large number of
bugs) doesn't resolve this.  Then please verify that

  DisableWin32AcceptEx On
  EnableSendfile Off
  EnableMMAP Off

in your httpd.conf doesn't resolve these problems (it sounds like your issues
might be resolved by EnableSendfile off).  Check what additional network socket
drivers are installed, e.g. AntiVirus network filters or firewall products that
are installed on this local machine.  Many such programs have known-incompliant
socket layer providers, that fluxor the Apache server.

Mans, your bug is entirely unreleated and didn't belong here.  However, it does
sound that you need to file it on the php.net bugtracking system, and please
make careful note if the PHP version you are testing on 1.3.33 and 2.0.55 is
absolutely identical.  If so, it's likely a bug in the php4apache2.dll module.
